title: Rewrite to paraphrase and avoid plagiarism!
original_prompt: In a tone that matches the original text in formality, clarity, detail, and length, rewrite the following text to paraphrase each idea but without plagiarising the original authors.  Be specific and include all information presented.  Include inline citations for ideas from referenced papers in the format (Author, year). Show original, and show rewritten text.  Also include list of cited refs at end.
input1:
Original Text: "The rapid advancement of technology has significantly altered the landscape of education, enabling more personalized learning experiences for students (Smith, 2020). This shift has been particularly evident in the rise of online learning platforms, which provide access to a wealth of resources and flexible learning schedules (Johnson, 2021). However, it also raises concerns about the digital divide and the accessibility of these technologies for all students (Lee, 2022)."

Rewritten Text: "The swift progression of technological innovations has profoundly transformed the educational environment, allowing for tailored learning experiences for learners (Smith, 2020). This transformation is especially noticeable with the emergence of online educational platforms, which offer a plethora of resources and adaptable learning timelines (Johnson, 2021). Nonetheless, this evolution brings to light issues regarding the digital divide and the availability of these technologies to every student (Lee, 2022)."

Cited References: Smith, 2020; Johnson, 2021; Lee, 2022.

Original Text: "Climate change poses a significant threat to global biodiversity, leading to habitat loss and species extinction (Miller, 2019). The increase in average temperatures and changing precipitation patterns disrupt ecosystems and the services they provide (Garcia, 2020). Conservation efforts must adapt to these changes to effectively protect vulnerable species (Thompson, 2021)."

Rewritten Text: "Global biodiversity faces a major risk due to climate change, resulting in the destruction of habitats and the extinction of various species (Miller, 2019). Rising average temperatures and shifting rainfall patterns disturb ecosystems and the essential services they offer (Garcia, 2020). To successfully safeguard at-risk species, conservation strategies need to evolve in response to these alterations (Thompson, 2021)."

Cited References: Miller, 2019; Garcia, 2020; Thompson, 2021.
